title: can i run windows xp totally in RAM like linux puppy?

forumNotes.author: Cybergrace
forumNotes.content:
I would like to know whether the following is possible ![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif) :  
my requirements are:  
1)to run windows XP totally in RAM(my system's ram is 4gb) and   
2)have no OS(either windows or linux) anywhere in my harddisk  

I have heard that puppy linux boots from cd,everything in the cd is   
loaded to RAM and then the cd can be removed from the cd drive   
without causing the OS to interrupt.Is it possible for "damn small linux"   
to run from RAM similarly?  
If yes,can i run virtualbox in DSL(after remastering the DSL boot cd   
with virtualbox and harddisk image file which contains windows xp)   
and ultimately run windows xp inside virtalbox?  
Finally can i use grub4dos or some other bootloader to boot from the iso   
file(created from the remastered dsl boot cd) placed in the 1st partition   
of the harddisk(so that i dont have to carry the cd with me all the time)?  

thanks ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Yes, it is possible. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  

Is it easy? NO.  

We have now two very good RAMDISK drivers (firadisk and WinVblock) that can "hook" a ramdisk presented by grub4dos or Syslinux.  

Actually building a "real" XP totally in RAM, while possible, as it has been demonstrated by Euhenio some time ago, is not very easy.  

Luckily enough, there is now a partially automated builder:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...ic=9830\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9830&hl= "External link")  

Start from it, possibly using a USB stick as media, take your time to get the hang of it "as-is", before introducing variations you may need.  

![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif)  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Icecube
forumNotes.content:
It is not because MEMDISK is included in the Syslinux project, that you can say that Syslinux has ramdisk features.  
MEMDISK doesn't need to be booted by a Syslinux like bootloader. Grub, grub4dos, grub2, gujin, lilo, ... can use MEMDISK too to emulate floppy disks, hard disks or CD disks.  
The Syslinux package for example also includes eltorito.sys (Dos CD-Rom device driver for use in making PC-bootable CD-Roms that (should) boot on any interface (Atapi and SCSI)), which doesn"t necessary needs to be used in conjuction with ISOLINUX.  
> I could settle for "Syslinux's Memdisk". ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)
![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif)
